column5: BOSTON  Dec 16 Billionaire hedge fund investor William Ackman  whose funds have suffered double-digit losses this year  on Tuesday told investors that 2015 could be his firm's worst ever  but said clients are generally sticking with him.

column4: UPDATE 5-Valeant says can contain hit to dermatology  projects 2016 growth
column5: * Shares rise 8 percent   (Adds detail from meeting  CVS Health comment)

column4: BRIEF-Valeant CEO says company is not exploring any divestitures
column5: * Valeant CEO says company is not contemplating a break-up    (Reporting By Caroline Humer)

column4: House Democrats to seek testimony from Valeant in coming weeks
column5: WASHINGTON Democrats on a U.S. House of Representatives panel are planning to call Valeant Pharmaceuticals Chief Executive Michael Pearson to testify in early 2016 about steep price hikes for some of the company's drugs  a Democratic aide said.

column5: WASHINGTON  Dec 16 Democrats on a U.S. House of Representatives panel are planning to call Valeant Pharmaceuticals Chief Executive Michael Pearson to testify in early 2016 about steep price hikes for some of the company's drugs  a Democratic aide said.

column4: BRIEF-Valeant CEO says double digit organic growth will continue
column5: * Valeant CEO says will not budget research and development as a certain percentage of sales  but will review it regularly

column4: Mystery Santas pay for $484 000 in U.S. shoppers' Walmart purchases
column5: CLEVELAND Secret Santas gave an early Christmas gift to shoppers at Walmart stores in three states by anonymously paying off $484 000 they owed on holiday purchases set aside with the retailer.

column4: Mystery Santas pay for $484 000 in U.S. shoppers' Walmart purchases
column5: CLEVELAND  Dec 16 Secret Santas gave an early Christmas gift to shoppers at Walmart stores in three states by anonymously paying off $484 000 they owed on holiday purchases set aside with the retailer.

column4: Wells Fargo eyes insurance brokerage acquisitions
column5: Wells Fargo & Co  is restarting efforts to expand its insurance brokerage business through acquisitions after previously announced M&A aspirations did not pan out.

column4: Wells Fargo eyes insurance brokerage acquisitions
column5: Dec 16 Wells Fargo & Co is restarting efforts to expand its insurance brokerage business through acquisitions after previously announced M&A aspirations did not pan out.

column4: Whirlpool seeks duties on Samsung  LG washers made in China
column5: WASHINGTON Whirlpool Corp asked the U.S. government on Wednesday to impose duties on washers made by Samsung Electronics and LG Electronics in China  alleging that they are being sold in the United States at prices below production costs.

column4: UPDATE 1-Whirlpool seeks duties on Samsung  LG washers made in China
column5: WASHINGTON  Dec 16 Whirlpool Corp asked the U.S. government on Wednesday to impose duties on washers made by Samsung Electronics and LG Electronics in China  alleging that they are being sold in the United States at prices below production costs.

column4: Whirlpool seeks import duties on washing machines from China
column5: WASHINGTON  Dec 16 Whirlpool Corp filed a complaint with the U.S. International Trade Commission on Wednesday against what it said were cheap imports of washing machines from China  which could end in duties on goods made by companies including Samsung Electronics and LG Electronics.

column4: Wipro flags flood hit to Q3 earnings
column5: MUMBAI Wipro  India's third-largest software services exporter  warned investors on Wednesday that heavy flooding in Chennai would hit revenues and operating margins for the quarter ending on Dec. 31.
